verses.text: To the chief Musician, Maschil, \add A Psalm\add* of David, when Doeg the Edomite came and told Saul, and said to him, David is come to the house of Ahimelech. Why boastest thou thyself in mischief, O mighty man? the goodness of God \add endureth\add* continually.
Thy tongue deviseth mischiefs; like a sharp razor, working deceitfully.
Thou lovest evil more than good; \add and\add* lying rather than to speak righteousness. Selah.
Thou lovest all devouring words, O \add thou\add* deceitful tongue.
God shall likewise destroy thee for ever, he shall take thee away, and pluck thee out of \add thy\add* dwelling-place, and root thee out of the land of the living. Selah.
The righteous also shall see, and fear, and shall laugh at him:
Lo, \add this is\add* the man \add that\add* made not God his strength; but trusted in the abundance of his riches, \add and\add* strengthened himself in his wickedness.
But I \add am\add* like a green olive tree in the house of God: I trust in the mercy of God for ever and ever.
I will praise thee for ever, because thou hast done \add it\add* : and I will wait on thy name; for \add it is\add* good before thy saints.
